recipe.ingredients: - cannellini beans (rinsed and drained): 2 cans (15 ounces each) - carrots (diced): 2 large - celery stalks (chopped): 2 - onion (chopped): 1 large - garlic cloves (minced): 3 - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - low-sodium vegetable broth: 4 cups - diced tomatoes (no salt added): 1 can (14.5 ounces) - spinach (fresh): 2 cups - Italian seasoning: 1 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon - fresh parsley (chopped, for garnish): 1/4 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Saut√© Vegetables: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the carrots, celery, onion, and garlic and cook until the vegetables are softened, about 5-7 minutes. 2. Add Liquids and Seasonings: Stir in the cannellini beans, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Season with Italian seasoning and black pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and let it simmer, uncovered, for about 20 minutes. 3. Add Spinach: Stir in the spinach and continue to cook until the spinach is wilted, about 5 minutes. 4. Garnish and Serve: Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 45g, Dietary Fiber: 15g, Sodium: 150mg, Saturated Fat: 0.5g, Total Fat: 4g, Protein: 15g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 7g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 964 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Cannellini Beans: 470 calories per two cans Carrots: 50 calories Celery: 12 calories Onion: 45 calories Garlic: 13 calories Olive Oil: 119 calories Low-Sodium Vegetable Broth: 80 calories Diced Tomatoes: 53 calories Spinach: 14 calories Italian Seasoning, Black Pepper, Parsley: Negligible - Serving People: 4
